action.name: Assess_patient_symptoms
action.script:
"Diabetes symptoms:
Increased urination.
Increased appetite or loss of appetite.
Excessive thirst.
Visible weight loss.
Blurred vision.
Recurrent skin infections.
Fatigue.
Vaginal infections or infections of the foreskin in uncircumcised men.
Slowly healing sores.
"

action.name: Glucose_test
action.script: "Fasting blood sugar (FBS) measures blood glucose after you have not eaten for at least 8 hours (normal: 70 and100 milligrams per deciliter (mg/dL))."

action.name: Glucose_test
action.script: "Fasting blood sugar (FBS) measures blood glucose after you have not eaten for at least 8 hours (normal: 70 and100 milligrams per deciliter (mg/dL))."

action.name: Glucose_test

action.name: Cholesterol_test
action.script:
"Diabetes tends to lower HDL cholesterol levels and raise triglyceride and LDL cholesterol levels, which increases the risk for heart disease and stroke.
Normal values
Total: below 200 mg/dL
LDL: below 70 mg/dL
HDL: 40 mg/dL and above (men)
50 mg/dL and above (women)
Triglycerides: below 150 mg/dL
"

action.script: "Fasting blood sugar (FBS) measures blood glucose after you have not eaten for at least 8 hours (normal: 70 and100 milligrams per deciliter (mg/dL))."

Total: below 200 mg/dL

HDL: 40 mg/dL and above (men)

"

action.name: Cholesterol_test
action.script:
"Diabetes tends to lower HDL cholesterol levels and raise triglyceride and LDL cholesterol levels, which increases the risk for heart disease and stroke.
Normal values
Total: below 200 mg/dL
LDL: below 70 mg/dL
HDL: 40 mg/dL and above (men)
50 mg/dL and above (women)
Triglycerides: below 150 mg/dL
"

action.name: Assess_diabetes
action.script:
"Fasting blood sugar (FBS) glucose level of 100-125mg/dL means impaired fasting glucose, a type of prediabetes. This increases the risk for type 2 diabetes.
Fasting blood sugar (FBS) glucose level of 126 mg/dL and higher most often means diabetes.

Cholesterol test levels do not influence the diabetes diagnosis but are a risk factor that should be considered and assesed.
"
